column2: ALASKA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column10: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 2. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 3. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column10: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 4. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 5. You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
column6: leave a note on the vehicle and report the accident with no delay.
column8: wait for the owner to return.
column10: call your insurance company within 14 days.

column2: 6. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
7. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 8. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
9. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
10. This road sign means:
11. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 12. This sign means:
13. Statistics show that alcohol is:
column4: involved in almost half of all traffic deaths.
column8: the cause of all traffic crashes.
column10: rarely involved in any traffic crashes.

column2: 14. If your vehicle is not equipped with ABS, pumping your brakes when you want to slow down:
15. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column10: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 16. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
17. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column10: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 18. This white sign means you:
column4: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

column2: 19. When two vehicles approach an open intersection with no traffic control devices at the same time:
column4: the vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
column6: the vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.
column8: both vehicles must stop and wait for instructions.

column2: 20. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.
column6: if the pedestrian signals to the driver that the driver must stop.
column8: only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road.
column10: even when the pedestrian crosses the street without looking both ways.
